channel.title: CVE Feed for ckp267 -- MaxiBlocks: 2200+ Patterns, 190 Pages, 14.2K Icons & 100 Styles
channel.description: The latest CVEs for ckp267 -- MaxiBlocks: 2200+ Patterns, 190 Pages, 14.2K Icons & 100 Styles

item.title: CVE-2024-6885|2024-08-01T21:45:38.220Z -- ckp267 -- maxiblocks%3A%202200%2B%20patterns%2C%20190%20pages%2C%2014.2k%20icons%20%26%20100%20styles
item.description: The MaxiBlocks: 2200+ Patterns, 190 Pages, 14.2K Icons & 100 Styles plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to arbitrary file deletion due to insufficient file path validation in the maxi_remove_custom_image_size and maxi_add_custom_image_size functions in all versions up to, and including, 1.9.2. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to delete arbitrary files on the server, which can easily lead to remote code execution when the right file is deleted (such as wp-config.php).

item.title: CVE-2024-6885|2024-07-23T02:01:41.694Z -- ckp267 -- maxiblocks%3A%202200%2B%20patterns%2C%20190%20pages%2C%2014.2k%20icons%20%26%20100%20styles

This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to delete arbitrary files on the server, which can easily lead to remote code execution when the right file is deleted (such as wp-config.php).
